page.title: 01A SECTION OF ETTRICK VALLEY
page.content: This part is crossed by the River Ettrick and the road from Upper Ettrick to Selkirk. A few fields are cultivated for hay and silage but most of the ground is steep rough grazing carrying a stock of Scottish Black-Faced Sheep and beef-type single-suckling cows. Farming is the main occupation but some of the farm cottages have been bought by people who commute to nearby towns. The area contains blocks of coniferous trees most of which have been planted in the last twenty years. The river is fished for salmon and brown trout and there is a little shooting for pheasant and grouse. Wildlife includes rabbits, hares, roedeer, foxes, mink and numerous small rodents and many moorland birds. Although thinly populated there is a very lively social life centred in nearby village.
